elements.text: TEST
GOV-5 - Risk management and internal controls over sustainability reporting
The undertaking shall disclose the main features of its risk management and internal control system in relation to the sustainability reporting process(es).
34 (a): Disclose the scope, main features and components of the risk management and internal control processes and systems in relation to sustainability reporting:
34 (b): Disclose the risk assessment approach followed, including the risk prioritisation methodology:
34 (c): Disclose the main risks identified, actual and potential, and their mitigation strategies including related controls:

34 (d): Provide a description of how the undertaking integrates the findings of its risk assessment and internal controls as regards the sustainability reporting process into relevant internal functions and processes:
34 (e): Provide a description of the periodic reporting of the findings to the administrative, management and supervisory bodies:
IRO-1-E1 – Description of the processes to identify and assess material climate-related impacts, risks and opportunities
The undertaking shall describe the process to identify and assess climate-related impacts, risks and opportunities.
18 (a): The companies impacts on climate change, in particular, the undertaking’s GHG emissions:
18 (b): Climate-related physical risks in own operations and along the value chain:
Temperature-related
Temperature-related

Temperature-related acute:

Solid mass-related acute:

elements.text: 36: Does the company produce energy?
In addition the undertaking shall disaggregate and disclose separately its non-renewable energy production and renewable energy production in MWh.

S1-9 – Diversity indicators
The undertaking shall disclose the gender distribution at top management and the age distribution amongst its employees.
65 (a): Specify the gender distribution in number and percentage at top management level amongst its employees:

elements.text: G1-6 – Payment practices

The undertaking shall provide information on its payment practices to support transparency about these practices given the importance of timely cash flows to business partners, especially with respect to late payments to small and medium enterprises (SMEs).
33 (a): What is the average time the company takes to pay an invoice from the date when the contractual or statutory term of payment starts to be calculated, in number of days?

33 (b): A description of the undertaking’s standard payment terms in number of days by main category of suppliers and the percentage of its payments aligned with these standard terms is required here.

elements.description: Is the company dealing with standard contractual payment terms that differ significantly depending on country or type of supplier?

elements.text: An example of what the description of standard contract term disclosures in paragraph 33 (b) could look like:

ABC’s standard contract payment terms are payment on invoice for wholesalers which encompass approximately 80% of its annual invoices. It pays for services received within 30 days after receipt of the invoice which are about 5% of its annual invoices. The remainder of its invoices are paid within 60 days of receipt except for those in country X which in accordance with the marketplace standards are paid within 90 days of receipt.
33 (c): What is the number of legal proceedings (currently outstanding) during the reporting period for late payments?
33 (d): Include complementary information necessary to provide sufficient context:
Is the CRSD relevant for your company?

G1-6 – Payment practices

The undertaking shall provide information on its payment practices to support transparency about these practices given the importance of timely cash flows to business partners, especially with respect to late payments to small and medium enterprises (SMEs).
33 (a): The average time the company takes to pay an invoice from the date when the contractual or statutory term of payment starts to be calculated
33 (b): The undertaking’s standard payment terms in number of days by main category of suppliers and the percentage of its payments aligned with these standard terms
33 (c): Number of legal proceedings (currently outstanding) during the reporting period for late payments
33 (d): Complementary information necessary to provide sufficient context
G1-6 done?
